1239711982288338944.text: Heartfelt gratitude to my co-host, @SenTinaSmith, Dr. Rob Thomas of EPPA, Lisa Shannon of @AllinaHealth, Dr. Kelly Searle of @UMNews + 1,000s of Minnesotans for joining our coronavirus briefing call. We shared info, answered q’s and feel blessed to represent our remarkable state.

1239703136677376001.text:
Dr. Rob Thomas, Emergency Physician: 

"Providers don't have all the answers right now. We are anxiously awaiting our scientists and researchers to find a cure. There is nothing harder than being a caregiver that can't help."

1239702315961122818.text:
Lisa Shannon, @AllinaHealth COO:

"Remember that social distancing is physical distancing. We are not asking you to isolate - phone people, video chat. We can do this together. Reach out and support one another without being physically near one another. We can slow the spread."

1239702314858020865.text:
Lisa Shannon, @AllinaHealth COO:

"We have to slow the spread because we don't want patients to transmit this illness and we need to make sure clinicians are available to take care of people with heart disease, cancer, and coronavirus."

1239701370694926346.text:
Dr. Rob Thomas, Emergency Physician: 

"Nobody has immunity to this. We are not overreacting. Emergency clinicians are used to handling emergencies, but we are worried about our patients' safety and our own safety."

1239700742044356609.text:
Dr. Kelly Searle, @UMNews epidemiologist:

"This is unprecedented, a global pandemic, and very serious. We are working together to get through this, but it is different than anything we've seen - a 5 day incubation means people can transmit before they are aware they're sick."

1239699662124339200.text:
Dr. Rob Thomas, Emergency Physician: 

"The evidence is showing that if someone is 71 and in good health, they are still at increased risk for this disease. Everyone in the population is susceptible to this infection, but the immune system weakens as we age."

1239698931833077760.text: For the most part, young people aren't showing the worst symptoms of the disease - but that doesn't mean they aren't being infected by it. Grandparents should use caution and lean on technology to stay connected with their families.

1239698066401263616.text:
.@SenTinaSmith:

"We have one of the best, strongest, and deepest food supply systems in the world. Empty shelves are putting pressure on our stores, but know that there is no reason to think there will be a shortage of food."

1239698065369509889.text:
Dr. Kelly Searle, @UMNews epidemiologist:

"You should cancel your travel plans. COVID-19 can travel quickly and efficiently through people. Whether you feel healthy or not, when we decrease our network and immediate contacts, we are decreasing who we can spread to."

1239696433768468482.text:
Lisa Shannon, @AllinaHealth COO:

"If you feel symptoms, remove yourself from other people. Call your doctor before you get in the car. This protects you and health care providers from getting into an environment where exposure can happen."

1239695504050716673.text:
Dr. Rob Thomas, Emergency Physician: 

"Common symptoms for coronavirus might feel early on like the common cold. It starts with a sore throat, sometimes a fever, and deeper into the illness a shortness of breath can develop."

1239694432288546817.text:
Dr. Kelly Searle, @UMNews epidemiologist:

"Surfaces such as mail and deliveries can have the virus on them if touched by infected individuals. The virus can remain for up to 24 hours on cardboard. Wash your hands afterhandling mail and packages."

1239693887251283969.text:
Dr. Kelly Searle, @UMNews epidemiologist:

"Everyone is susceptible. Idividually and collectively we can wash our hands every time we have contact with anothe rperson or surface. It is also best to keep six feet between individuals."

1239692498638966785.text:
Dr. Kelly Searle, @UMNews epidemiologist:

"#COVID19 has shown to be incredibly transmissible. The curve is growing. When we talk about physical and social distancing we are talking about breaking the chain of transimissions to reduce the number of cases in our community." https://t.co/KF8rgazXH4

1239690641296232451.text:

1215432717392805888.text: I recently traveled to the Persian Gulf to meet with our military leaders & service members & their families. They’re in my prayers, and deserve to be supported by a leader with a steady hand, a well-conceived strategy, and a Congress willing to exercise its Constitutional duty.

1215432716470099970.text: Thus, it’s my hope and intention to inspire a new generation of leadership in Congress that commits to enhanced collaboration and reduced division - particularly on issues of such gravity. To that end, a small, bipartisan group of us met this evening to begin that process.

1215432715513757696.text: So in affirmation of our Constitution, I voted today in support of the War Powers resolution. But I’m disappointed with the decision to bring it to the floor at this moment - for if such resolutions aren’t fully bipartisan, it sends a risky message to our allies & our enemies.

1215432714645659648.text: As a Gold Star son, I know the immeasurable human cost of war. Our founding fathers felt it so essential to have vigorous debate before sending young Americans to battle that our Constitution requires Presidents to obtain congressional approval before doing so.

(6/6) As a Gold Star Son, my gratitude to our men and women in uniform is immeasurable. I look forward to working with my #MN03 Veterans Advisory Council and the House Veterans Affairs Committee to serve our military members, veterans and their families.

https://t.co/U6v24TSGAd

1171534657671684102.text: (5/6) Speaking of oversight, I'm proud that we finally passed the Blue Water Navy Act. The new law will bring justice to so many vets who deserve benefits for their sacrifices, but I'm concerned about its implementation. The VA must process claims in a timely and thorough manner.

1171534654832140295.text: (4/6) Our veterans must have access to quality mental health programs. Congress should use its oversight authority to ensure that access to mental health and suicide prevention programs as mandated in the Clay Hunt Act of 2015 are being thoroughly and effectively provided.

1171534652479168513.text: (3/6) There is a clear need for a Community Based Outpatient Clinic in southwest #MN03. Right now, the closest CBOC is is run down, has a confusing layout, and is not accessible from the highway. I urge the VA to find CBOC sites that would be more accessible to our veterans.

1171534648930791424.text: (2/6) Thanks to @GovTimWalz, MN is leading the way on ending veteran homelessness, a national issue that demands action now. Congress can support this mission by providing incentives to landlords who open up their spaces to veterans in need of permanent housing.

1143636364832989187.text: Thus, I urge all of my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to support today’s funding package in the House and begin the hard work of addressing our broken immigration system -- so such human tragedy never occurs again. (8/8)

1143636363448868866.text: Our existing facilities were not designed to accommodate the number of people being processed. That’s why it is vital that the House pass this necessary emergency funding to provide relief. When people are suffering in inhumane conditions, we have a responsibility to act. (7/8)

1143636362261946368.text: Nobody I spoke with at the border wants this to be the norm. US Customs and Border Patrol treated the migrants they received with compassion. They simply do not have the resources, or oftentimes the training, to adequately handle the number of migrants entering the country. (6/8)

1143636361003569154.text: Instead of taking accountability and working to fix these shocking problems, the Administration is arguing in court that children don’t need toothbrushes or soap to live in sanitary conditions. It is wrong, it is un-American, and it cannot be tolerated any longer. (5/8)

1143636359657250816.text: As a parent, I’ve seen little in my life that has horrified me more than the conditions on our southern border. And as an American, I am appalled by the lack of leadership and action. (4/8)

1143636358302507009.text: I witnessed young people fighting the flu and chicken pox being held in overcrowded cells that all but guaranteed the rapid spread of both illnesses. (3/8)

1143636357132300292.text: I witnessed children and families in overcrowded fenced cages, sleeping on concrete floors and with limited access to portable restrooms. I witnessed mothers with infants in outdoor fenced pens gathered under water misters that provided little relief from 107 degree heat. (2/8)

1143636355525857281.text:
Earlier this month, I visited McAllen, TX on a bipartisan mission to see conditions at our southern border with my own eyes. What I saw was a very real and urgent humanitarian crisis. (Thread: 1/8)

My statement ⬇️ https://t.co/0GB6WKzxCx
